subject: Psychology
title: Group Polarization
description: Learn Group Polarization in one minute.

hook.text: Moderates enter a discussion and extremists come out. The group didn't find the middle â€” it ran to the edge.

buildup.text: Group polarization is the tendency for groups to make more extreme decisions than individual members would alone.

discovery.text: Two mechanisms drive it: hearing persuasive arguments you hadn't considered, and competing to be the most committed.

twist.text: Social media algorithms feed like-minded content, creating echo chambers that mimic and amplify group polarization.

climax.text: Diverse groups resist polarization. Hearing opposing views prevents the drift toward extremes.

punchline.text: Groups don't average opinions. They amplify them.

quiz.question: What is group polarization?
options: Groups making more extreme decisions than individuals would
Individuals becoming less opinionated in groups
